author: Anonymous
text:

I've been very patient considering holidays/COVID.  NO ONE from VC has contacted me about any delays.  I have no product, nor money to show for the sale. author: Julia
text:
Bought a Saint Laurent Lou bag which was pictured with an authenticity card. 

Paid for it to have an authenticity check at Vestiaire, and it passed, super.

The item arrives and the authenticity card has a COMPLETELY DIFFERENT BAG LISTED ON IT!

I contact Vestiaire and they request I send the item back for a second authenticity check. I do.

Today I receive an email to say it has passed once more and has been relisted on my account, what? Even though the authenticity card is completely incorrect?! 

This makes no sense to me.

Update, 4th January: I've received an email offering me a 10% voucher off a max. purchase of 300 GBP. I don't want a voucher, I want a REFUND. I don't want the bag relisted on my account for somebody else to be essentially scammed and for Vestiaire to profit off the ADDED COMMISSION!, and I don't want it shipped back to me, it's DODGY. I want my hard-earned money back!

Update, 27th January: Earlier in the month Vestiaire eventually agreed to refund me after much back-and-fourth with a customer service department that could be compared to conversing with a broken robot, but by that point I had already disputed the charge with American Express, and had my money rightfully returned to me. 

They say in their email the item will be “exceptionally relisted under Vestiaire Collective”… right, so somebody else will have the exact same problem. 

Having £600 stuck in limbo has caused me so much stress. I’m happy this is over and would never advise anybody ever purchases from this company.
title: Never Again!

author: RX
text:
DO NOT BUY/SELL on Vestiaire Collective.  I sold my item Ref. 18871106 on 10/30/21. VC emailed me and I sent the item to the Buyer 11/1/21 using the address provided to me from VC. On VCs website I notified them that the package had been sent and provided the USPS Tracking No. I contacted the Buyer on 11/9/21 to let them know their package was on it's way. For some unknown reason from the date the package was picked up at the P.O. 11/1/21 it was held in NJ for 8 days.  I received another email that the item had been Authenticated. The buyer did not receive the package until 11/10/21. I asked VC when would I receive payment.  They told me after they rec'd confirmation from the Buyer, I would receive payment, but I should wait to hear from them. They contacted the Buyer who said they had no problems with the item. The next email said that payment had been triggered and to expect any day. After waiting several days, I contacted VC again to find out the status of payment. They said the Buyer had cancelled the order and had been refunded the money owed to me. I have sent attachments of my usps tracking receipts, copies of emails from Customer Service, chats conversations. They have not sent me back my Balenciaga Boots worth $400 to me. Nor paid me because the Buyer decided to keep the boots.  All I've gotten from VC is they are working on returning the item to me or getting back the refund they sent to the Buyer. I don't care what they do, all I want is either payment for my sale; or return my merchandise to me.
I wish I had known there were so many complaints against this consignment site. I will NEVER use them again, and I advise you to go elsewhere. You'll never be compensated!!!!

author: Slv90
text:
I received a obvious counterfeit (No RFID in a modern Fendi bag) despite paying for authenticity checks. Turns out their authenticity checks don’t actually check authenticity and just check the product quality.

I explained how the item was counterfiet, including taking photos. I was asked to return the item within 7 days, and they’d get back to me within 5 days. It took them 2 weeks to get back to me.

Instead of providing a refund,they’ve relisted the counterfeit item for sale on my account. If/when the item sells they will give me the sale price minus their 15% of fees and postage. So I won’t get the full amount back, or potentially anything back if it doesn’t sell.

This means they make 2 sets of fees, one from my purchase and anither from the resale. While I loose my authenticity check money, the bag, plus a minimum of 15% of the product value in fees. I am also being forced into selling a counterfeit item under my account (which is illegal).

I’ve asked for a full report from their authenticity check but all I get told is: ‘They have concluded that the item meets the standards of the brand‘ and they checked ‘Leather, stitching and finishes, metal parts.’ These checks mean absolutely nothing, checking the ‘standard of the bag’ is very different from checking its authenticity. Many counterfeits are made to a high standard, with real leather, good stitching and high quality trims. So the only way to check their authenticity is to check the RFID, serial numbers, or labels— which they don’t do. 

Also worth noting that at no point have they told me that they found the item to be genuine. Despite selling it as an ‘authenticity check’ they’ll only confirm the ‘quality’ of the item to me and refuse to provide details on any checks related to labels, serial number, and receipts.
title: Fake item— Refused refund but they’ve kept the item
